title: Firefly looking ahead after “To The Black” payloads reenter early
summary: On Oct. 1, 2022, Firefly launched the “To The Black” mission which successfully deployed three satellites into low Earth orbit. However, space tracking data showed that the satellites were deployed at a lower-than-planned altitude, and just two weeks after launch, all payloads have reentered Earth’s atmosphere.

title: SES to appeal Intelsat C-band sharing decision
summary: SES filed plans Oct. 14 to appeal a court’s decision last month that disallowed its bid to equally split nearly $9 billion of anticipated C-band clearing proceeds with Intelsat.

title: Satellite broadband players poised to compete for U.S. military customers
summary: While Starlink continues to build momentum in the U.S. defense market, other industry players are positioning to compete for military customers

title: China considering mission to Ceres and large dark matter space telescope
summary: The Chinese Academy of Sciences is considering potential missions including a Ceres orbiter and a huge telescope to hunt for clues about the nature of dark matter.

title: NASA outlines case for making sole-source SLS award to Boeing-Northrop joint venture
summary: A procurement document sheds new light on the formation of a joint venture to which NASA plans to award a long-term contract for producing the Space Launch System rocket.
